<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">[Song of Strength](/Spells.aspx?ID=732)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=60" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 228 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Single Action" /></row>
<row>[verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 60-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

You bolster your allies' physical strength with a hearty exhortation. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks and to their DCs against Athletics skill actions such as [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41), [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), and [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40). 

**Special** If you have the [_inspire heroics_](/Spells.aspx?ID=388) composition spell, you can use that composition to improve the bonus granted by _song of strength_ in the same way as [_inspire courage_](/Spells.aspx?ID=386) or [_inspire defense_](/Spells.aspx?ID=387).
name: Song of Strength
